intro: Conospermum intricatum, commonly known as the tangled conospermum, is a shrub native to Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its dense, often twisted growth habit. The plant features narrow, leathery leaves that are typically grey-green in color. It produces small, spherical fruits that are yellow when mature. Conospermum intricatum is well adapted to dry, rocky environments and is often found in coastal regions.
